metadata.Title: CVE-2016-4052 on Ubuntu 14.04 LTS (trusty) - medium
metadata.Description:
Multiple stack-based buffer overflows in Squid 3.x before 3.5.17 and 4.xbefore 4.0.9 allow remote HTTP servers to cause a denial of service orexecute arbitrary code via crafted Edge Side Includes (ESI) responses.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2016-4052` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

squid - 3.3.8-1ubuntu6.8
squid-cgi - 3.3.8-1ubuntu6.8
squid-purge - 3.3.8-1ubuntu6.8
squid3 - 3.3.8-1ubuntu6.8
squid3-common - 3.3.8-1ubuntu6.8
squidclient - 3.3.8-1ubuntu6.8
No subscription required

criterions.comment: squid3 package in trusty was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '3.3.8-1ubuntu6.8').
